node.cardPreview: Online Payment Options in Colombia aren’t the easiest or most convenient. That’s because accepting credit cards in Colombia can be difficult but don’t worry.. we’ve put together a list of the best solutions!
node.title: How to accept credit cards 4

content.value: ONLINE PAYMENT OPTIONS IN COLOMBIA

Online Payment Options in Colombia aren’t the easiest or most convenient. That’s because accepting credit cards in Colombia can be difficult but don’t worry.. we’ve put together a list of the best solutions!
1. GO OLD SCHOOL- LOCAL BANK
It is possible to get a point of sale (POS) system from banks in Colombia such as
Davivienda
and
Bancolombia
to receive a credit card payment for a client.  The best way to do this is to schedule an appointment with a bank.
The process is pretty opaque and time-consuming. Fees vary depending on the bank, what type of credit card the traveler uses and what type of business you’re operating.
2. TREKKSOFT
Trekksoft
focuses specifically on tour companies. They offer a payment solution, integration with your website and a channel manager.
Their fees range from $50 to $200 per month with a 2-3% booking fee. There’s also an additional 3.25% + €0.50 per transaction fee.
Unfortunately, it’s not currently possible to accept Pesos with Trekksoft.
3. TAB
Tab
helps tourist businesses take payments online, in-person and charge no-shows.They charge a 2.9% fee and there are no monthly fees or sign-up fees.

The traveler also pays a 4% fee but as they can pay in their home currency, they don’t pay any fees to their bank (usually around 3-7%). Therefore, Tab is usually cheaper for the traveler as well as the business.

One of the main advantages of Tab is that they can send Pesos or USD directly to your bank account in Colombia (or abroad) free of charge. It’s very quick to set-up; just complete their online application and you can start accepting credit cards within a few days.
4. PAYU
PayU
offers in-person payments and online payments. You can also accept subscriptions or installments. They have a broader focus rather than concentrating on tourism.
PayU charge a 3.49% + $900 COP fee per transaction. 3 withdrawals per month are free; subsequent withdrawals cost $6,500 COP + VAT.
5. PAYPAL
Paypal
has the best brand recognition internationally but the fees are high and it’s difficult to get paid into a Colombian bank account. This is our
How-To Guide
and breakdown on how to do it.
They charge 5.4% plus $0.30 per transaction. They also charge a currency conversion rate of 3.5% bringing the total to 8.9% plus $0.30.

Linking PayPal to a Colombian bank account isn’t easy. If you set-up an account with Davivienda for example, you will be charged a $10 fee to transfer PayPal funds and you’ll also have to pay a COP 40,000 “portal fee” to the bank. You can read more about the process
here
